value.title: 5 AWESOME things about the new ribbon in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Power BI Desktop has a new ribbon! Patrick shows you 5 awesome things about it that you may not be aware of.  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Add a measure without Power BI Desktop (Premium)
value.excerpt: Need to add a measure to your Power BI dataset? Can't download it back in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you how you can still add that measure even though you can't use Power BI Desktop!  Tabular Editor 2 https://github.com/TabularEditor/TabularEditor  Tabular Editor 3 https://tabulareditor.com/  ðŸ“¢

value.title: Column Profiling in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Adam walks through column profiling within the Power BI Desktop. This includes the latest updates with the general availability (GA) within the April 2019 Power BI Desktop release.  Demo files: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Fuzzy match / merging in Power BI Desktop (October 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the new fuzzy match / merging option within the October 2018 version of Power BI Desktop. This feature is incredibly powerful when it comes to data matching and can be adjusted to meet your needs.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI Reports and Buttons (new with Power BI Desktop - April 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at Power BI reports and buttons. Buttons were added to Power BI Desktop in the April 2018 release. You can now add buttons to your Power BI reports and configure actions for when they are selected.  Bookmarks and selections are a powerful combination with Power BI reports

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop. value.title: Using Custom Format Strings in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how to use custom format strings in Power BI Desktop. From dates and time to numbers, he calls out some things to look out for.  Custom Format String Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-custom-format-strings  Download sample file: https://guyinacu.be/customformatstringsample

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Connecting Excel to Power BI Desktop using DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can connect Excel to Power BI Desktop copying the connection string from Power BI Desktop. Useful to test your model for Excel consumption before publishing to Power BI service.

value.title: Loading a File from OneDrive Personal into Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: I am sure you know, there are quite a few companies that provide online document storage for free, including Dropbox (which is my personal favourite) but also Google Drive and OneDrive Personal (Microsoft). This article today shows how you can load data from OneDrive Personal (stored in the cloud) directly

value.title: The Most Important Update to Power BI Desktop, Ever!
value.excerpt: The December 2020 version of Power BI desktop has just been released, and it is undoubtably the most important release since the first version way back in 2015. The super feature that has been released is an update to composite models using direct query of online datasets. The implications of [...]Read

value.title: Add DAX calculation groups to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: Learn how you can add many similar measures to your model.

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: Use DAX in Power BI Desktop to solve business problems
value.excerpt: In this module, youâ€™ll solve three different business problems by optimizing the data model and creating Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) calculations.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Design interactive data experiences with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Power BI enables report authors to produce interactive reports using visuals, slicers, bookmarks, and more.

value.title: 3 Best practices when transforming data in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, I go through the what I believe are best practices for cleaning your data in Power BI: 1. Rename your query steps 2. Change Data types to all columns 3. Write comments on query Steps (juni 2016 update) and other tricks.  Here is a link to the Power BI file, if you want to check it out:

value.title: Automatic custom backgrounds for Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you with no effort besides the original set up, create stunning reports every single time? In this tutorial, i will show you how to set up a custom background for every new page automatically, so you reports wont look dull and white and will stand out among the crowds. value.title: Create a data connection shortcut with PBIDS files - Power BI desktop update October 2019
value.excerpt: The power bi team has released a new Power bi file extension called PBIDS (power bi direct source), that allows you to configure a file with all the connection details of a data source. Here is how you configure it and my thoughts on it.  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center
